Title: Operator precedence by textual substitution
Description:
Operator precedence is a traditional feature of mathematical notation where,
absent explicit parentheses, some operators bind tighter than others ("have
higher precedence"). For example, a + b × c would be interpreted as
a + (b × c), not as (a + b) × c, because multiplication has
higher precedence than addition.

Title: Site Reliability Engineering with PagerDuty's Stevenson Jean-Pierre
